com.stripe.android

Class CustomerSession

  • com.stripe.android.CustomerSession

  • public class CustomerSession

    Represents a logged-in session of a single Customer. See Creating ephemeral keys

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CustomerSession.ActivityCustomerRetrievalListener<A extends Activity> 
      static class  CustomerSession.ActivityPaymentMethodRetrievalListener<A extends Activity>
      Abstract implementation of PaymentMethodRetrievalListener that holds a WeakReference to an Activity object.
      static class  CustomerSession.ActivityPaymentMethodsRetrievalListener<A extends Activity>
      Abstract implementation of PaymentMethodsRetrievalListener that holds a WeakReference to an Activity object.
      static class  CustomerSession.ActivitySourceRetrievalListener<A extends Activity>
      Abstract implementation of SourceRetrievalListener that holds a WeakReference to an Activity object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCustomerSource()
      Add the Source to the current customer.
      void addProductUsageTokenIfValid() 
      void attachPaymentMethod()
      Attaches a PaymentMethod to a customer.
      static void cancelCallbacks()
      End any async calls in process and will not invoke callback listeners. It will not clear the singleton instance of a CustomerSession so it can be safely used when a view is being removed/destroyed to avoid null pointer exceptions due to async operation delay. No need to call CustomerSession.initCustomerSession again after this operation.
      void deleteCustomerSource()
      Delete the Source from the current customer.
      void detachPaymentMethod()
      Detaches a PaymentMethod from a customer.
      static void endCustomerSession()
      End the singleton instance of a CustomerSession. Calls to CustomerSession.getInstance will throw an IllegalStateException after this call, until the user calls CustomerSession.initCustomerSession again.
      Customer getCachedCustomer()
      Gets a cached customer, or null if the current customer has expired.
      static CustomerSession getInstance()
      Gets the singleton instance of CustomerSession. If the session has not been initialized, this will throw a RuntimeException.
      void getPaymentMethods()
      Retrieves all of the customer's PaymentMethod objects, filtered by a PaymentMethod.Type.
      static void initCustomerSession()
      Create a CustomerSession with the provided EphemeralKeyProvider. You must call PaymentConfiguration.init with your publishable key before calling this method.
      static void initCustomerSession()
      See CustomerSession.initCustomerSession
      static void initCustomerSession()
      See CustomerSession.initCustomerSession
      static void initCustomerSession()
      See CustomerSession.initCustomerSession
      void retrieveCurrentCustomer()
      Retrieve the current Customer. If the cached value at #mCustomer is not stale, this returns immediately with the cache. If not, it fetches a new value and returns that to the listener.
      void setCustomerDefaultSource()
      Set the default Source of the current customer.
      void setCustomerShippingInformation()
      Set the shipping information on the current customer.
      void updateCurrentCustomer()
      Force an update of the current customer, regardless of how much time has passed.

    • Method Detail

      • initCustomerSession

        public static void initCustomerSession()

        Create a CustomerSession with the provided EphemeralKeyProvider.

        You must call PaymentConfiguration.init with your publishable key before calling this method.

        See Also:
        PaymentConfiguration.init

      • initCustomerSession

        public static void initCustomerSession()

        See CustomerSession.initCustomerSession

        See Also:
        CustomerSession.initCustomerSession

      • initCustomerSession

        See CustomerSession.initCustomerSession

      • initCustomerSession

        public static void initCustomerSession()

        See CustomerSession.initCustomerSession

        See Also:
        CustomerSession.initCustomerSession

      • getInstance

        public static CustomerSession getInstance()

        Gets the singleton instance of CustomerSession. If the session has not been initialized, this will throw a RuntimeException.

        Returns:
        the singleton CustomerSession instance.

      • endCustomerSession

        public static void endCustomerSession()

        End the singleton instance of a CustomerSession. Calls to CustomerSession.getInstance will throw an IllegalStateException after this call, until the user calls CustomerSession.initCustomerSession again.

        See Also:
        CustomerSession.getInstance, CustomerSession.initCustomerSession

      • cancelCallbacks

        public static void cancelCallbacks()

        End any async calls in process and will not invoke callback listeners. It will not clear the singleton instance of a CustomerSession so it can be safely used when a view is being removed/destroyed to avoid null pointer exceptions due to async operation delay. No need to call CustomerSession.initCustomerSession again after this operation.

        See Also:
        CustomerSession.initCustomerSession

      • addProductUsageTokenIfValid

        public void addProductUsageTokenIfValid()

      • retrieveCurrentCustomer

        public void retrieveCurrentCustomer()

        Retrieve the current Customer. If the cached value at #mCustomer is not stale, this returns immediately with the cache. If not, it fetches a new value and returns that to the listener.

      • updateCurrentCustomer

        public void updateCurrentCustomer()

        Force an update of the current customer, regardless of how much time has passed.

      • getCachedCustomer

        public Customer getCachedCustomer()

        Gets a cached customer, or null if the current customer has expired.

        Returns:
        the current value of #mCustomer, or null if the customer object is expired.

      • addCustomerSource

        public void addCustomerSource()

        Add the Source to the current customer.

      • deleteCustomerSource

        public void deleteCustomerSource()

        Delete the Source from the current customer.

      • attachPaymentMethod

        public void attachPaymentMethod()

        Attaches a PaymentMethod to a customer.

      • detachPaymentMethod

        public void detachPaymentMethod()

        Detaches a PaymentMethod from a customer.

      • getPaymentMethods

        public void getPaymentMethods()

        Retrieves all of the customer's PaymentMethod objects, filtered by a PaymentMethod.Type.

      • setCustomerShippingInformation

        public void setCustomerShippingInformation()

        Set the shipping information on the current customer.

      • setCustomerDefaultSource

        public void setCustomerDefaultSource()

        Set the default Source of the current customer.
